answerText: Leyden jar [DO NOT reveal if it is not given, but prompt on capacitor][10] The Leyden jar is a simple example of this type of circuit element for storing charge. A typical example consists of two parallel metal terminals separated by a dielectric material.
heading: Illinois Fall Touranment |2012 | 5 | 5 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: A simple one of these devices consists of a glass jar coated on the inside and outside with conducting foil and containing a round metal ball mounted in the middle. For 10 points each: [10] Name this simple device invented in the 1700s that stores electric charge.
